Isolation precautions are barriers between people and germs. These precautions prevent the spread of germs.[^198]

Healthcare providers and visitors need to follow __Isolation Precautions__ of wearing gowns, gloves and sometimes masks if the patient's door has an Isolation Precaution sign on it.

  ![isolation stuff](//images.ctfassets.net/xbvvg00rroa3/6VTF4KABnayciesYuYEGMY/5b5f6c8e53d2c9261b6e6c7df9876595/isolation_stuff.svg)

### Contact Precautions:[^198]

- Wear a gown and gloves while in the patient’s room.
- Remove the gown and gloves before leaving the room.
- Clean hands (hand washing or use hand sanitizer) when entering and leaving the room.
- Visitors must check with the nurse before taking anything into or out of the room.
- Visitors should not eat or drink in the patient's room

### Droplet Precautions:[^198]

- Wear a surgical mask while in the room. Mask must be discarded in trash after leaving the room.
- Clean hands (hand washing or use hand sanitizer) when entering and leaving the room.
- Visitors should not eat or drink in the patient's room
- Visitors must check with the nurse before taking anything into or out of the room.

### Airborne Precautions:[^198]

- Wear a fit-tested NIOSH-approved N-95 or higher level respirator while in the room. Mask must be discarded in trash after leaving the room.
- Clean hands (hand washing or use hand sanitizer) when entering and leaving the room.
- Ensure the patient wears a surgical mask when leaving the room.
- Visitors need to wear a  mask while in the room.
- Visitors should not eat or drink in the patient's room
- Visitors must check with the nurse before taking anything into or out of the room.

[Isolation Precaution Information from Medline](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/patientinstructions/000446.htm)

[Transmission-Based Precautions from CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/infectioncontrol/basics/transmission-based-precautions.html "Transmission-Based Precautions from CDC")

[^198]: US National Library of Medicine. Isolation precautions. MedlinePlus website. [https://medlineplus.gov/ency/patientinstructions/000446.htm](https://medlineplus.gov/ency/patientinstructions/000446.htm). Reviewed September 29, 2019. Updated March 30, 2020. Accessed August 21, 2020.
